result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety

Complete a Thinking for a Change course

Anger management counseling to be determined by agent

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons

Operate a motor vehicle only with a valid driver's license

Pay financial obligations in Counts 2, 3 and 4

No new law violations
Maintain/obtain full-time employment (35hrs per week) within the first 30 days of extended supervision

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

10:19 AM Defendant Steven M James in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew H Huppertz in court for Steven M James.  Attorney Susan L. Opper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for sentencing hearing.
Both counsel have reviewed the presentence investigation report.
Recommendations by Attorney Opper.
Attorney Opper excused by the court.
Recommendations by the Defense.
Statement by defendant.


The Court Orders the Following:

Count 2:
36 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 240 days) CONCURRENT with Counts 3 and 4
-	18 Months of Initial Confinement
-	18 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Complete Thinking for a Change Course;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 30 days of extended supervision;
-	Anger management counseling to be determined by Agent;
-	Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Driver's License;
-	Pay financial obligations in Counts 2, 3 and 4;
-	No new law violations;

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



Count 3:
6 Months Jail.  (Credit - 240 days)  CONCURRENT with Counts 2 and 4

DL REVOCATION: 36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

FINE:  $ 1494.00

IID Surcharge: $ 50.00

Transcript Fee: $ 14.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to the District Attorney's Office

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision in Counts 2 and 4. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

AODA Assessment and follow through	




Count 4:
84 Months Imprisonment (Credit - 240 days) CONCURRENT with Counts 2 and 3
-	36 Months of Initial Confinement
-	48 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Same as Count 2;
-	Complete 20 hours of community service per year of extended supervision;

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Sentencing hearing on September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:27 PM Defendant Steven M James in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew H Huppertz.   Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State filed a Second Amended Information in 22CF217.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the second amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2, 3 and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 5, 6 and 7 are dismissed and read in.  Cases 22TR836, 22TR837, 22TR838, 22TR839, 22TR840, 22TR841 and 22TR863 are dismissed and read in to this matter.
State requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders a presentence investigation be completed and a report filed prior to the next court date.
Court orders bail revoked pending sentencing.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle.  Defendant to have no contact with victims/witnesses/Police officers (unless in the event of an emergency or if the officers initiate contact) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives/anything used to maim or kill.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on February 4, 2022.

03:26 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven M James in court by telephone means, in custody at the Waukesha County Jail with attorney J Andrew Herbers, in person.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he would like a Court appointed attorney as he does not believe will qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court notifies defendant he must first be evaluated by the Public Defenders office but will also have the deputies provide the jail with a copy of the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel in the event the defendant does not qualify so he may fill it out prior to the next date.  The Court puts on record that the Defendant hung up the phone at 3:42 pm after the Court placed its bail amount on record.  The Court will set this matter for a status of counsel date next Thursday and the Public Defenders Office to evaluate the defendant prior to the next date.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
